did.unittitle: Administrative correspondence

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes a few items written to Emmett L. Holt and to James U. Norris, but mainly administrative correspondence with and through the hands of the Business Manager. Mainly items dealing with affairs of the Institute including antivivisection campaigns, appointments, buildings and landscaping, distribution of Salvarsan, publications (Journal of Experimental Medicine, Monographs), purchases and development of New York City and Princeton properties; exemptions from draft for certain laboratory workers, salaries and personnel matters. Some correspondence with others on the Board of Scientific Directors or employees.

Many handwritten notes and notations to Edric B. Smith while abroad or away for summer months. Several handwritten notes from Mrs. Flexner. Including reprint from Proceedings of the American Academy of Arts and Sciences v. 60, no. 14, Dec. 1925 of Memorial to Abraham Jacobi written by Simon Flexner. Also includes publicity speech, Triumphs of Experimental Medicine, delivered January 27, 1933 over station WJZ, by Simon Flexner.
Non-routine items under the following dates.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Between 1934 when Simon Flexner planned his retirement as Director of The Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research until 1940 Dr Flexner kept an office at the Institute where he worked on a biography of William Henry Welch. Box 4 consists of correspondence between Dr. Flexner and E. B. Smith, Business Manager who saw to the collection of material, financial arrangements for the support of the writing and many other details. After 1940 when Simon Flexner gave up his office at the Institute many details were still handled through Mr. Smith until Dr. Flexner' s death in 1946 when the Institute was involved in details of newspaper notices, funeral preparations and finally in the Memorial Service held 12 June 1946.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: These were selected from the files by Mr. E.B. Smith, for their historical value when Dr. Flexner was working on his history of Dr. Welch.

The letters mainly deal with Institute business when Dr. Flexner was abroad or away on vacation or while hospitalized for illness and the business manager at the time handled matters and informed Dr. Flexner.

did.unittitle: Correspondence between Simon Flexner and Waldo Flinn

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Between 1928 and 1944 Waldo Flinn was assistant to Business Manager Edric B. Smith. Under his direct supervision were matters of personnel involving non-scientific staff; publications; the administrative operation of the various support services and various other duties involving the care and maintenance of the laboratories.
Special mention is made only of special interest items.
